cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 570 miles southwest of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn west-northwest on Friday, northwest on Saturday, and then north toward the northern Baja California Peninsula and the southwest United States early next week

weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-west Mexico, southern and central Baja California Peninsula, and the southern California coastline (mainly surf/rip currents)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy gusts below gale force possible late Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in San Diego Bay, but long-period swells could elevate surf 5–8 ft at open-ocean entrances.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture plume could bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal San Diego County Monday–Tuesday, locally higher in mountains/deserts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend.
